subject: Doping (Sports)
lead_paragraph: Operation Puerto, cycling’s biggest doping investigation, has ended without a conviction. The Spanish news media reported that a judge officially sealed Operation Puerto, which had implicated more than 50 riders. Raids in Madrid and Zaragoza in May 2006 turned up steroids, hormones, the endurance-boosting substance EPO, nearly 100 bags of frozen blood and equipment for treating blood. U.C.I., cycling’s governing body, is working with the lawyers for the World Anti-Doping Agency and the International Olympic Committee to try to see the evidence in the investigation.
